Deficiency Narrative: A direct care staff applicant was present at the operation and in the presence of children in care before the operation received an eligible background check determination.
Correction Narrative:
The operation sent an email with a letter of acknowledgement. The operation reports misinterpreting TAC that staff could attend orientation, introduction and training with residents present. Moving forward, all training and orientation will be conducted after the
background has cleared for an applicant. A schedule was sent showing the AP is not on schedule to return until 7/21/2024 OR the operation receives notification from CBCU that the individual can be present at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was found that a caregiver was not in a position to visually supervise children in care leading to the children leaving the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation held a discussion with staff on active supervision. Signatures were obtained. A night log for note taking was created for the staff on duty to document movement and checks conducted. A photograph of the location in which staff will be stationed at night was taken during the inspection. Night staff have a desk and chair situated in a manner that they can see down both hallways.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation policy and procedure manual must specify how soon the child will be seen by the LPC for a suicide risk assessment.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy manual. (Page 79) If a suicide risk screening finds a child to be a potential risk for suicide, she will be referred to a Mental Health professional immediately for a suicide risk assessment (within 24 hours), specifically our LPC and/or the 24 hour on-call crisis team vis Imagine Pediatrics.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation policy and procedure manual is missing this component / section.
Correction Narrative:
The operation policy manual was updated, and a copy was provided. (Page 79) Upon completion of the risk assessment
the circle of support will be contacted with a follow up on the recommendation by the mental
health professional. The childs safety and service plan will reflect the most recent
recommendations.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation policy and procedure manual states residents are not able to give gifts to friends, employees, or other residents in while in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy manual. (Page 13) Residents have the right to receive and give gifts to family members, CASA workers, Attorney Ad Litem, and/or caseworkers. Residents can give gifts to friends, employees, or other residents in Dawn Rises care in the presence of the LCCA and/or therapist. The gifts given to employees or other residents associated with Dawn Rise cannot exceed $25 and cannot be a monetary gift. The resident is not able to utilize funds sent from family, Case Workers, Casa Workers, Attorneys, etc for specific purposes on gifts for Dawn Rise employees or fellow residents.

Deficiency Narrative:
The operation policy and procedure manual is missing this component / section.
748.125(g)(1)(B)(I thru VI)(iii)
748.125(g)(2),(B),(D), E( i)(ii) and (F)
Correction Narrative:
The operation has updated their policy manual. (Page 79-80) 1. The Postvention Team is an extension of the Crisis Team that includes the Case Manager,
Treatment Director, Therapist, Psychologist, & Psychiatrist. The team will devise a written plan.
2. The Professional Service Level provider will meet within 3 hours to ensure safety, construct a
plan, and help the resident slowly transition back into the routine by completing daily hygiene and
participating in the scheduled program activities .
3. Information about the incident will be provided to the highest level Mental Health professional at
the school campus prior to her returning to school
4. A Safety plan /Action Plan will be implemented at school and home. This Safety Plan /Action Plan
will include a plan to help the resident transition back to her regular routine/program. This Safety
Pla n/Action Plan will also include a self-care plan that will identify coping skills and resident
identified activities that promote healing/restores hope/minimizes a reoccurrence.
5 . Increase in individual therapy services weekly. Weekly suicide risk assessments for 30 days or
until the child no longer reports suicidal thoughts for 3 consecutive weeks.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation policy and procedure manual is missing this component / section.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy manual. (Page 79) All attempts will be immediately reported and documented as a serious incident as required.

Deficiency Narrative:
The operation policy and procedure manual is missing the following component / section.
748.125(f)1, 2, A, B, C and 3.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated the policy manual. The professional service level provider will meet with a child within 24 hours of their return to Dawn Rise post hospitalization to discuss protocols that would help to ease the childs transition back into the operation, ensure the childs safety, and reduce any risk of suicide. The PLSP will complete a weekly suicide risk screenings for the first 30 days or until the child is no longer reporting suicidal thoughts, whichever is longer and the PLSP will create or review and update the childs safety plan. Upon removal of any harmful objects, chemicals, or substances that a child could use to carry out a suicide attempt or self-harm for a period to be determined by the treatment team, but not less than 30 days.

Deficiency Narrative: The discharge summary is not available for review.
Correction Narrative: The operation created and provided a copy of the discharge form that will be used when children discharge from the operation.

Deficiency Narrative:
The operation policy does not state how long the training will be or indicate the training will be instructor led.
As well as 748.125(c)(1)(A) The risk factors, protective factors, and warning signs of suicide.
Correction Narrative:
The operation updated their policy manual. (Page 78)
Suicide Trainings twice a year will be instructor led and that the curriculum provided by the LPC. LCSW, or LSSP will include the risk factors, protective factors, and warning signs of suicide.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation does not have provisions to store medication that requires refrigeration.
Correction Narrative: The operation has purchased and placed a combination lock box in the refrigerator. The lock box is on the top shelf of the refrigerator. A photograph of this installment was provided on the corrective action plan submitted.

Deficiency Narrative: The evacuation plan does not have a designated location inside the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated the evacuation / floor plan that depicts (with blue boxes) where residents / staff can take cover in the event of hazardous weather.

Deficiency Narrative: The evacuation plan does not have a designated location outside the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated the evacuation / floor plan that depicts (with a photograph outside) where residents / staff will meet in the event of a fire.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation policy and procedure does not have  Minimum Standard 748.105(3) procedure implemented.
Correction Narrative: The operation has updated their policy manual. (Page 42) The operation will ensure that applicants are suitable for any/all positions by verifying an applicant's employment history as required. The operation will conduct reference checks as required. This will be conducted by the LCCA contacting the last known employer to verify that the applicant previously worked at the documented establishment. Applicants are required to list three references on his/her applicationthe LCCA will call all references and document responses.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation policy and procedure manual does not designate a location for possessions to be stored that are prohibited.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy manual. (Page 14) Residents may not bring literature, music, clothing, or posters which contain sexually explicit materials, gang themes, or themes which promote violence, drug/alcohol use, exploitation of others, or discrimination of race, creed or handicaps. Items will be given to the caseworker during intake or sent upon retrieval. Any items that are prohibited, yet they make it into the house will be placed in a name labeled bin located in the garage and/or mailed back to the case worker within 72 hours. (The garage is a restricted area for all residents.) This includes items that are confiscated during searches

Deficiency Narrative: Monthly Drill record does not include the type of drill being conducted.
Correction Narrative: The operation submitted an updated form. The new form now has fire drill or weather drill.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation policy and procedure manual does not state whether  it offers a religious program or not.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy. (Page 15) While Dawn Rise would love for all of our residents to be involved in church, residents will not be punished/retaliated against for not sharing the same beliefs. Our girls will not be punished for not participating in church or religious activities. Personal beliefs will not prohibit medical treatment. Religion will not be a factor when considering procedures for routine medical visits, emergency diagnosis, including treatment of mental and dental problems.

Deficiency Narrative: The operations policy manual does not make TB testing a qualification or requirement for volunteers.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy manual. (Page 47) TB testing as a requirement for volunteers before having contact with our residents.

Deficiency Narrative: One upstairs bedroom would require occupants to cross the game room to the bathroom.
Correction Narrative: The operation confirmed the bedroom on the second floor will no longer be considered / used as a bedroom for residents. This bedroom is directly to the right of the stair top exit. The room is 12'9" x 10'3" and will be used and an all-purpose room. Residents in this bedroom would be required to cross the game room to the bathroom.  The operation will not be making modifications to the home. No new floor plan or measurement will be required.

Correction Narrative:

Deficiency Narrative: The 'Keeping Children Safe' sign was not posted during inspection.
The operation policy and procedure manual does not describe how random drug testing will be conducted.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policy manual on page 70. Applicants may not provide care or have access to any child in Dawn Rises care until appropriate drug test results are obtained. In addition, random drug screenings will be conducted. Every employee is subject to random unannounced drug tests. Quarterly (January, April, July, October), Dawn Rise will put all employee names in descending order according to his/her hire date. The person that falls in the middle will be notified and given 3 hours to complete the random drug screening. The employee will need to report to any AnyLabNow location; Dawn Rise will settle the cost for all random drug testing.
